programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson follows the renovation of the Grange, a house in Ramsgate, Kent, formerly owned by 19th-century architect Augustus Pugin, co-creator of the Houses of Parliament. Pugin's designs for the home became a blueprint for thousands of properties built after his death and in 20 years he succeeded in changing the face of England. With the help of experts such as Grand Designs' Kevin McCloud, the Landmark Trust aims to restore a piece of history.

programme.desc: The presenter spends a year working with the team of engineers who have been commissioned to rebuild the most famous steam engine in the world. Starting in February, Robson is given the task of cutting off the front end of the Scotsman and welding on a whole piece, and sets out to Durham, where he discovers how the invention of the steam engine helped to change the world. After a year in the workshop, the iconic train is ready for its first test run, and Robson realises a lifelong dream and gets to ride on the footplate as it sets off.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: The Blue Planet

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: Documentary featuring dramatic reconstructions and interviews with historians to examine the network of spymasters and secret agents that helped protect Elizabeth I from assassination, terror and treason for more than 40 years. The first edition reveals how the pope's declaration of Elizabeth as a heretic 12 years into her reign set England's Catholics against her, leading the queen to charge William Cecil with the task of stopping assassins getting through, and the huge espionage network he established saw his spies break Catholic conspiracies at home and abroad.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Time Team

Initial searches suggest the remains of Roman villas could be located on the site, and the team begins to build up a picture of the highs and lows of life in the society of the time - until the cold weather threatens to bring the excavation to a premature halt. Presented by Tony Robinson.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson gets to choose a site for investigation and decides to take the team to Jersey, where a German anti-aircraft battery was built during the Second World War. programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: An elderly woman addicted to trashy thrillers gets a taste for life on the wrong side of the law. Dandy Nichols and Philip Davis guest star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie has managed to get away with Derek for a weekend in the Cotswolds, leaving Aveline in charge of the cooking.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Young Mr Grace celebrates his birthday, so the staff decide to organise a cabaret in his honour. Another chance to see the 1978 Christmas special of the comedy, starring John Inman and Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: After years apart, Lionel is reunited with Jean but takes a bigger interest in her daughter. Each believes they have nothing in common any more. First-ever episode of the comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Invented Yorkshire Funny Stuff
programme.desc: Howard is dismayed when Marina unwittingly buys him a life-like gorilla which attracts the attention of the local police. Meanwhile, a newspaper article prompts Truly, Clegg and Billy to try to track down Cyril Cooper - a man renowned for his green fingers and womanising ways. Comedy, starring Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective investigates a murder connected to vaudeville entertainers Harry and Al Jolson, while Watts unravels a mystery about his own family.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mayor is electrocuted while speaking at the Kembleford village fete, and Father Brown suspects he was the victim of a deliberate act. Meanwhile, Mrs McCarthy's past comes back to haunt her. Mystery, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is suspended after assaulting a high-ranking officer in the Met, suspecting him of covering up a death in custody years before. Meanwhile, an Argentinian pistol recovered from the Thames is linked to two unsolved murders which took place 16 years apart - and with one of them having occurred in Gibraltar, Sandra takes the team - minus Brian - on an Iberian adventure to uncover the truth. Alun Armstrong, Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star in the crime drama.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The discovery of a teenager's remains halts an eco-housing project, putting Nikki and Jack under pressure to help solve the mystery so construction can continue - and leading to an unexpected romance for Nikki. Meanwhile, Leo is caught up in a dangerous hospital siege when distraught father Tom Hancock holds a ward at gunpoint, insisting his terminally ill son's life-support is switched off. Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves star, with Mark Womack and Ed Stoppard.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The birth of Tilly's baby brings excitement to the workshop, but Beatrice is still concerned about her own future. Evie accuses Daniel of betraying her trust.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice's baby is born prematurely, taking everyone by surprise, and Evie longs for the chance to see Daniel again.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Stephen Fry in Central America
programme.desc: Stephen travels through Belize, the only former British colony in Central America, bottle-feeding injured manatees, hearing the music of the Garifuna people and meeting a reformed drug addict living 40 miles off the mainland on the Turneffe Flats. On arrival in Guatemala, he learns to weave with the Mayan people and teams up with an ex-Miss Guatemala on the banks of Lake Atitlan, before a night patrol with a volunteer heart surgeon.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson heads to Liverpool along with the squad of dealers. Michael Hogben got time on his hands with some watches and Tracy-Thackeray-Howitt gets a centre-piece shock. Plus, Henry Nicholls and the den get blown away by a real rarity.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites contestants Paul, Ian, Caroline and Lucille to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jimmy is happy to put the past behind him, Pete is concerned about Moira, and Kim is suspicious of Graham's motives.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz and Tyrone learn that Hope can return to school, and Roy criticises the inefficiency of Richard's carer. Meanwhile, Adam advises Michelle to abandon her plan.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Ahead of the General Election, Ranvir Singh talks to Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the Scottish Nationalist Party. She also interviews the co-leader of the Green Party Sin Berry. Plus, Jonathan Hill meets Plaid Cymru leader Adam Price.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec provide coverage of the latest stage in the celebrity survival challenge, which sees a group of famous faces living in the Australian jungle, struggling to complete the tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials. Which of them will start to crack under the pressure?.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents the show in which a group of men enters the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Today's contestants are a carnival dancer, a magician, a city worker and a sports therapist.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the game show in which two teams of friends must battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000. Taking part this time round are Tanz & Bantz from Essex, and the Bowling Stones from Newcastle.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Ahead of the General Election, Ranvir Singh talks to Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the Scottish Nationalist Party. She also interviews the co-leader of the Green Party Sin Berry. Plus, Jonathan Hill meets Plaid Cymru leader Adam Price.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: It's a two part special, and Dana has made her own board game so that the whole family can learn about what happened to the Dinosaurs after a meteorite ended their kind.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A brilliant inventor plans to launch his newly constructed Hyperloop with a trial run, but when the machine begins to malfunction mid-circuit, it is up to Scott to find a way to slow it down. Animated adventure, with the voice of David Tennant.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop..

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are after the president's jokebook. But Magoo, thinking he's in his dojo, enters the high-security unit where it's kept....

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push, but for some reason the do-gooders don't want to push him all the way to the beach!.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave is given a bulb to grow. Popping it in his lunch box, it isn't long before he discovers it's partial to Betty's sandwiches..

programme.title: LEGO Jurassic World: The Legend of Isla Nublar
Mighty Magiswords!
programme.desc: Prohyas and Vambre attempt to tame two of their most problematic Magiswords - Taunting Jester and Carnivorous Plant - with the help of Kablammica..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef is joined in the kitchen by husband and wife 1980s singers Martin and Shirlie Kemp, who have recently collaborated on an album of swing covers, as well as chef Stephen Terry and forager Alysia Vasey. Plus, Oz Clarke shares his tips on the best wine for a Christmas party and continues his tour of Britain's best pubs.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha re-creates the family feasts of China with chef Jeremy Pang. The menu comprises the street food snack jianbing for breakfast, prawn toasts with smacked cucumber for lunch, Jeremy's claypot chicken and mushroom rice for lunch and Nadia's banana fritters for dessert.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Newbury
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 3.00 Ladbrokes Trophy Steeple Chase, and races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.40 from Newbury, Plus, races at 2.05 and 3.20 from Newcastle. With analysis from Ruby Walsh and AP McCoy, reports by Luke Harvey, Mick Fitzgerald, Alice Plunkett, Rishi Persad, Matt Chapman and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. In the sixth episode, the comedian meets an albino Pekingese riddled with health problems, and in need of an operation on his eye, which is making it difficult for him to find a new home. Meanwhile, a dog rescued from a near death experience in the Thames needs help overcoming his nerves, and a Labrador puppy arrives with a mystery illness affecting his lungs.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as impressionist Rory Bremner, weather reporter Laura Tobin, Dragons' Den's Deborah Meaden and TV gardener and chat show host Alan Titchmarsh pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The latest group of men to enter the 'love lift' are a Bruno Mars impersonator, a duck lover, a serial dater and a skip driver, who pull out all the stops in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Paddy McGuinness presents.

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the climax of the star-studded spin-off from the long-running singing contest. Over the past seven weeks, the line-up of famous faces has been whittled down to today's finalists, all under the watchful mentoring of judging panel Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh. In this grand final, they will perform to impress both the viewing public and the judges, with the most popular act being crowned as the first celebrity series champion and securing a recording contract.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the latest episode of the celebrity survival challenge, with the campmates facing the prospect of their third week in the jungle, with more tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials ahead of them - and for some, a ticket home.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by guests tennis champion Andy Murray, Luke Evans, recently seen in Second World War drama Midway, doctor-turned-comic and author of bestseller This is Going to Hurt Adam Kay, and comedian Desiree Burch. Plus, one of the biggest and hottest artists in the country, Stormzy, is chatting and performing in the studio.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring a child getting trapped in a deckchair, a cat falling through a ceiling, and a parachutist losing his false teeth.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends from Newcastle answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Mechanic finally completes Project Sentinel, and aims to test its destructive capabilities by making The Hood his first target. As the International Rescue team scrambles to save an old foe, Brains embarks on a dangerous mission to neutralise the Mechanic once and for all.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Can Danny handle the pressure of performing basketball tricks in front of hundreds of fans and avoid the messy forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler attempts to make his own home movie, a horror thriller with Mrs Wicket in the starring role. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler has to look after Mrs Wicket's goldfish, but Scrapper the cat is keen to help. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's a beach lifeguard but is actually on an ice floe and the swimmers are penguins..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo's going to miss his flight. Unfortunately, he's not at the airport, but the supermarket, where Fizz and Weasel are hatching their latest plan..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: The Prophecy of the Goldensand'S Dragon
programme.desc: Fizz is at the beach building a sandcastle. Magoo thinks they are preparing to thwart an attack by an enemy riding a dragon..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Spy School
programme.desc: The budding spies are called into action against Goldfist at Chelsea Football Club, and uncover a plot with Eden Hazard himself.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet serves up a selection of bakes that involve spices. She makes spiced pumpkin pie with a meringue topping, chocolate and chilli cookies and winter pavlova with spiced apples and pears. She also visits a Lebanese bakery and is joined by food and travel writer John Gregory-Smith, who makes date and cinnamon squares.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are starting to feel festive with a few winter warmers. Lisa begins with a blue cheese and butternut squash pie, followed by John's sausage casserole. They also serve a family favourite - macaroni cheese, with a twist - and for dessert it's a classic ginger cake served two ways.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by Asimakis Chaniotis, London's youngest Michelin-starred chef, to create a family feast from Greece. The menu starts with scrambled eggs for breakfast and chicken gyros for lunch. Then Asimakis rustles up his mum's meatball soup for dinner before Nadia makes Greek almond crescent biscuits for dessert.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield returns to put more Christmas gifts to the test, aided by his wife Steph, celebrity guests and members of the public. They begin by gearing up for Black Friday with tips on the best gifts and gadgets on the market. With sales of personal electric vehicles on the up, Corrie trio Jack AP Shepherd (David), Alan Halsall (Tyrone) and Colson Smith (Craig) put hoverboards and scooters to the test. Clare Balding is on a mission to find the pefect present for pets and Eddie 'the Eagle' Edwards ranks gift experiences such as track racing, skydiving and flyboarding.

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the climax of the star-studded spin-off from the long-running singing contest. Over the past seven weeks, the line-up of famous faces has been whittled down to today's finalists, all under the watchful mentoring of judging panel Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh. In this grand final, they will perform to impress both the viewing public and the judges, with the most popular act being crowned as the first celebrity series champion and securing a recording contract.

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Globetrotting Emma is house hunting for love with the help of her cousin Kelly - and she has a substantial list of demands to be met as she visits three single men's homes. In the running is a rugby player, a trendy musician and a bodybuilder. Which one will she choose to go back to her house for a date?.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011)
programme.desc: The teenage wizard continues his search for the artefacts containing fragments of the dark lord Voldemort's soul. Time is running out, as the evil sorcerer is aware of Harry's mission, and marshals his forces for a final, devastating attack on Harry and his friends at Hogwarts school. Conclusion of the fantasy saga, with Daniel Radcliffe, Ralph Fiennes, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson and Alan Rickman.

programme.title: The ITV Election Debate
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham hosts a debate to which seven parties in the General Election campaign have been invited, ahead of the poll on December 12. The parties are the Conservatives, Labour, the Liberal Democrats, the SNP, the Brexit Party, the Greens and Plaid Cymru. Brexit is likely to be high on the agenda for this debate, along with issues including the NHS, crime, education and climate change.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: As the campmates face being booted out of the jungle back into their life of luxury, who is ready to make that jump and who wants to stay another day? Presented by Ant and Dec.

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston narrates a selection of clips submitted by members of the public, which display in cringe-worthy detail some of the many things that can go wrong while away on holiday. A walk in the woods becomes a fight for survival, a man from Wales becomes a shark-wrestler, and an unfortunate holiday-maker ruins all his once-in-a-lifetime holiday snaps.

programme.title: Police, Camera, Auction
programme.desc: An insight into the auctions where criminals' assets from their nefarious activities are sold at auction, with the proceeds usually going to help those whose lives have been blighted by crime. From sports cars and designer goods to outrageous bling and strange collectibles, cameras reveal the broad range of criminals' possessions seized by specialist police teams and put under the hammer.The auctioneers and police discuss their work, while those victims who will benefit from the money wait anxiously to see the outcome of the sales.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits the jewel of the Italian Riviera - the Cinque Terre - five towns that are only accessible by boat or train. He begins in the smallest town, Corniglia, where he meets an opera-singing florist, before hopping on the train to Manarola and the dry-stone wallers responsible for keeping the towns from crumbling into the sea. As he heads toward the end, he also heading to Vernazza, Gino meets wine producers who scale 1,000m above sea level to tend to their vines.

programme.desc: Part two of two. Kath and Jenni fly to Germany to see how brothels are run legally and what it would mean for them if they could operate within the realms of the law. They then take their campaigning for the decriminalisation of brothels to the streets of Sheffield, determined to get the 5,000 signatures they need for an audience with the council.

programme.title: Stephen Fry in Central America
programme.desc: Stephen travels to El Salvador and Honduras, two of Central America's most dangerous countries, ridden with gangs and drug cartels. However, El Salvador also has some of the best waves in the Americas, and the presenter is soon persuaded to try his hand at surfing. Moving on to Honduras, he visits a banana plantation where new varieties are being developed and meets a woman convicted of killing and cooking six of her husbands, before stepping over the border into Nicaragua for a visit to a cigar factory and to learn how to dance the maypole.
